Entries.default: "My, Serafen. Is there anything you have a hard time with? Aside from humility."
"After spending so much time with Kana, I'm surprised. You're nothing like him."
"What happened to your armor? You always kept it so neat."
"I've noticed you seem to be frequently at odds with others in your order."
"I reckon I be half-handy at most things. More-so all things piratical."
"If only we were all as confident in real skills as you are in imagined ones."
"You'd be right surprised how far confidence'll take you, lad, were you ever to give it a try."
"For someone who talks so much, you seem to care about very little."
"Apologies, lad. Didn't realize we be only ever speaking of subjects deep and meaningful."
"I already have one guest in my head. I don't need another."
"I've already dislodged one trespasser from my head. I've no interest in another."
"Sorry, lad. Thought that chip on your shoulder were for all to see."
"Do you ever have a thought and just decide to... keep it to yourself?"
"More'n you know, my Aedyran mate. More'n you know."
"Oh, don't strain yourself on my account."
"When one of my order is cast out, we are obligated to remove the suns from our armor and wear it as a sign of our disgrace."
"You deserve leaders who honor your devotion."
"It sounds like the last five years have been good to you."
"I have been allowed to serve my country to the best of my ability. Ac, that is good."
"And I see you haven't changed a bit."
"You know, Pallegina, I never realized how much I missed your company."
"You just miss having someone standing in front of you when Iselmyr insults half of the people in a room."
"She won't try to touch your feathers again, that's for certain."
"Nothing seems to shake your faith in the Republics, Pallegina."
"Some people believe in the gods. I believe in the Republics. They will endure long after I am gone."
"But do you ever wonder what they'll become?"
"For all your doubt in the gods, how can you believe animancers are any more responsible?"
"The gods have never done right by me. Animancers have. Even a little responsibility is better than none at all."
"You place too much faith in them. Given the same license, they'll be just as bad."
"Guess poetry just has that effect on me."
"You could certainly do worse when it comes to family."
"Most birds I've seen leave quite a mess. How is Ishiza so tidy?"
"He isn't. In fact, he likes to hide his droppings between grimoire pages."
"Just when I thought I needed to relax my personal boundaries."
"I take it the hazanui runs a tight ship. Do you ever disagree with orders?"
"Naturally. And I bark about it until the boss tells me to stand down."
"You Rauataians aren't much for passive aggression, are you?"
"Some of my brethren don't understand why I got to do what I do. But I'm not beholden to them."
"I can certainly sympathize."
"Is... everything all right? You seem restless lately."
"Everything's so dark these days. You, me, the Watcher."
"You certainly seem cheerful lately. Sleeping better, I hope?"
"Sure am! Been sleepin' like a newborn babe. But, uh, less fussy."
"I don't suppose you could share your secret. I rarely get a decent night on the ship."
"I don't know how you and the Watcher sleep, carrying all those souls around."
"Some nights it's the lantern that lulls me to sleep. It pulses like a heart in my hand."
"I open my eyes, but I can't see the light in anyone. Not anymore."
"Well, I do sleep better when the Watcher's around. That's for sure."
"Oh, it's easy. You just got to get the tar shocked out of you when you dump a bunch a souls into a luminous adra pillar."
"...How about a soothing cup of khapa tea? Or maybe a good soak at the bathhouse?"
"If you find that comforting, then I'm glad for you."
"Does it suddenly feel warm in here to you?"
"Friend Aloth... I see you standing closer to the captain these days."
"For whatever it be worth, I think you and the cap'n be charting the right course."
"Say, Aloth... I may not be the quickest to catch on, but... I been seeing you and the Watcher talking a lot..."
"I'm sure I don't know what you're talking about."
"Were only saying it shows wits, knowing that not every heart's flutter needs be chased to the end of Eora."
"Talking? No harm in talking, is there? Not between two very special friends with lots to, er, talk about..."
"Are you two sharing jokes and not letting me in on it? Cause that wouldn't be right."
"Well, we have known each other for quite some time."
"For what are you bashful? Celebrate your conquest on every hilltop, I say!"
"Oh, it's easy. You just got to get the tar shocked out of you when you dump a bunch a souls into an animancer's repository."
"Especially not when it seems we're actually headed in that direction."
"I would hardly call it that. Besides, my idea of celebration is a little more... private."
"Knowing you inclinations about the gods, I'm surprised you didn't give Ruānu a piece of your mind."
"The songretta should not have disrespected you at the hearing."
"It seems the Huana have their own version of animancy. Reading the souls of the young to establish their roles."
"Ruānu is the ranga of Tikawara. I cannot risk the Company's interests here by offending him."
"And I suppose he did do enough talking for all of us."
"It is my duty to serve the interests of the ducs and the Company, even if the songretta may not welcome my presence."
"And do they owe you nothing in return?"
"You certainly seem to admire the luminous bathhouse, Aloth. It was made by animancers, of course."
"And if they devoted all their efforts to such endeavors, you wouldn't hear me complain."
"Is everything quite all right, Aloth? You have been troubled since we left the Spire."
"It's Flaune's project. Can you imagine what a danger that might be in the wrong hands?"
"Ac, but if we spent our time worrying about everything that could go wrong, we would never accomplish anything."
"Or we might avoid greater harm."
"Where do you draw the line between animancy and what the Huana do? Do you object to their practices as well?"
"Animancers attempt to alter what the Huana merely observe."
"I'm sorry about Giacolo. I know he meant a lot to you."
"Agracima. He is one of the only people in my life who cared for me as a person, not as a godlike."
"I can't help but think about his work. Don't you wonder at what might have happened if your parents had known...?"
"I'm relieved Giacolo is well. I know he means a lot to you."
"Ac. He was the first person in my life to care for me as a person, not just a godlike."
"Yet even he recognizes the dangers his work presents."
"Better him than one who does not recognize the danger, di verus?"
"Ac. And there are many days I have wondered if death would have been preferable to this."
"Aloth, I know it has been difficult to deal with your new responsibilities. Though it is my duty to serve, I face similar doubts."
"I used to see your dedication as the absence of doubt. But that's not it at all, is it?"
"Aloth, I know it could not be easy for you to abandon your responsibilities. I have wanted to do the same many times."
"I didn't abandon anything. Rather, I realized the harm I could cause was greater than the good I could do."
"When I was young, there was only passion, di verus, but with age, doubt crept in."
"If only all those in power had half your sense of responsibility."
"Say what you want about animancy, but it wasn't animancers who bound the sea dragon's soul beneath the Watershapers Guild."
"Of course that was wrong. But imprisoning dragons has hardly spread the way animancy has."
"That may have something to do with the availability of sea dragons, Aloth."
"Or the unflagging ambition of animancers."
"It is a wonder they manage at all without your wisdom and guidance."
"My friend, you hide your face in a book while the beauty of the Deadfire passes you by!"
"A readied mind will be far more useful the next time we face dragons, cultists, or fampyrs."
"You are ready to face death. What of life, I say?"
"If you've never experienced the pleasure in a good book, more's the pity."
"Of course, but my place is to protect the Republics for those who will shape its future."
"They've disowned you. You owe them nothing, least of all this humiliation."
"In their eyes, my devotion was misplaced. Perhaps it was. At least now I have another chance to prove myself to them."
"No more than they owe any other citizen of the Republics, to create the best possible future for the generations who follow us."
"It's fundamentally different."
"Even so, the Huana examine mere facets of a soul and purport to understand it. This, too, is dangerous."
"Not all animancers do, and most who do are attempting to fix, to cure maladies of the soul."
"I suppose you're right."
"I persist in my duty not because I ignore my doubts, but because I fight them every day."
"My debt and my duty are to my country. I will gladly accept humiliation from the ducs for another chance to serve the Republics."
"As much as you must hate to admit it, they are trying to do good where no one else dares."
